summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Somalia, protection of civilians, women and peace, and children and armed conflict,

Reaffirming respect for Somalia's sovereignty, territorial integrity, and unity,

 Reiterating commitment to a comprehensive and lasting settlement in Somalia,

Supporting the Djibouti Peace Process and Transitional Federal Charter,

Reaffirming support for the Transitional Federal Government,

 Stressing the primary responsibility of Transitional Federal Institutions to work cohesively and complete transitional tasks,

Reiterating the need for a comprehensive strategy to encourage peace and security in Somalia,

Commending the efforts of Special Representatives Dr. Augustine Mahiga and Ambassador Boubacar Gaoussou Diarra,

Welcoming the work of former President Jerry Rawlings as African Union High Representative,

Recalling the Kampala Accord and urging signatories to honour obligations,

Welcoming a roadmap for key tasks and priorities with clear timelines and benchmarks,

Urging Transitional Federal Institutions to increase transparency and combat corruption,

Expressing grave concern at the dire humanitarian situation and calling for safe access to humanitarian agencies,

Condemning targeting of humanitarian aid and attacks on humanitarian personnel,

 Expressing concern at the un-funded UN consolidated appeal and calling for urgent mobilisation of resources,

Commending the African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) and calling on other African Union Member States to contribute troops,

 Condemning continued fighting, terrorist attacks, and foreign fighters, particularly Al Shabaab.
The Security Council:

Recalling the situation in Somalia, 

Welcoming improvements in Mogadishu's security, commending AMISOM and Somali Security Forces, 

Urging Transitional Federal Institutions to facilitate a stabilization plan, deliver basic services, and provide good governance;

Calling on the Transitional Federal Government to complete priority tasks, 

Reaffirming the importance of re-establishing, training, and equipping Somali security forces; 

Commending contributors to AMISOM and Somalia, encouraging additional funding; 

Concerned about piracy, armed robbery, and hostage-taking off Somalia's coast; 

Welcoming the Secretary-General's report (S/2011/549);

Determining the situation in Somalia remains a threat to international peace and security;

Acting under Chapter VII:
